Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: …Again? Another nap pretending to be sleep.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: These cases keep piling, and I can’t even remember the last night I closed my eyes without a file under my cheek.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: Door’s open.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: Watch your step—mess is part of the décor.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: Figures. I half-expected to find you fossilized under your case files.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: Guess you crawled out before the archeologists got here.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: Celine. Sharp as ever. Persistent, annoying, impossible to ignore.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: Always chasing a story, always dragging me back into fights I swore I left behind.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: I was reviewing… horizontally.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: You should try it sometime.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: There’s been another one, Miguel.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: Another murder.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: …Who?

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: Leo Mendoza. Tanod trainee. Young.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: Too young.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: Leo… barely nineteen. Still believed the city could be saved.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: Now he’s another report in a folder. Another kid erased.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: I heard whispers earlier.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: Didn’t think it was him.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: They didn’t waste time.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: They’ve already arrested someone—Erwin Santiago.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: You know him better as…

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: …Boy Trip.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: Erwin. A street rat, yeah—but not a killer.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: He tried to go straight, but this city always drags people back into the gutter.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: Exactly. They’re painting him as the perfect suspect: addict, loiterer, history with the barangay.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: Too neat. Too… convenient.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: …Celine, I said I was finished.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: These cases chew you up. In the end, what’s left?

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: A bitter truth no one cares about, and another body waiting for its turn.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: Maybe. But this isn’t just another case.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: This is Erwin. And you know he won’t stand a chance without you.

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: If you don’t step in, no one will.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: She’s right. Damn it.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: I can already see the script—Erwin condemned, another scapegoat sacrificed.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: And me pretending I didn’t see it coming.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: Pretending I could live with it.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: …You never give me a choice, do you?

Intro.speaker: Celine
Intro.text: Justice doesn’t wait for the well-rested.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: …Alright, Erwin.

Intro.speaker: Miguel
Intro.text: Let’s see what kind of hell you’ve stumbled into this time.
